Class LoginScreenController

  • java.lang.Object
    • home.LoginScreenController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class LoginScreenController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Login screen allowing to login to user that registered in the system

      • isUserInputValid

        private boolean isUserInputValid​(java.lang.String username,
                                 java.lang.String password)
        Parameters:
        username -
        password -
        Returns:
        if GUI Fields are not empty or a user is already logged in check GUI login validation

      • setRespondToServer

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> setRespondToServer​(java.lang.String username,
                                                                                      java.lang.String password)
        Parameters:
        username -
        password -
        Returns:
        Status of input correlated to DB and user details, If can send username and password from GUI to DB through Server

      • responseAction

        private void responseAction​(java.lang.String username,
                            java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> response)
        Parameters:
        username - Username Given from GUI
        response - Login Information Returned from Server Check Login Status(NEW_LOG_IN=Valid,ALREADY_LOGGED_IN=Not Valid,NOT_REGISTERED= Not Valid,SUSPENDED=,Not Valid) IfValid Try to Login User If Flow Allows and Change The Screen According to the Flow. Flows: Catalog:Customers-> Catalog,else-> User Home. Cart:Customers->Greeting Card,else = CANNOT LOG IN Home:Every User->User Home

      • loginUser

        private void loginUser​(java.lang.String username)
        Parameters:
        username - Username given from GUI set all user data from DB and save as current user

      • cartFlow

        private void cartFlow()
        Login in cart screen only allows customers users to login and continue to make a purchase

      • catalogFlow

        private void catalogFlow()
        Login in catalog screen if customer stay in catalog else change send to home screen

      • loginFromCart

        public static void loginFromCart()
        Parameters:
        isCartFlow - Set login flow to be from cart

      • loginFromCatalog

        public static void loginFromCatalog()
        Parameters:
        isCatalogFlow - Set login flow to be from catalog

      • setLoginFlow

        private static void setLoginFlow​(boolean isFromCart,
                                 boolean isFromCatalog)
        Parameters:
        isFromCart - Set Flow Of Login From Cart
        isFromCatalog - Set Flow Of Login From Catalog Open login popup and set behavior
